    • Constructor Detail

      • AvlTree

        public AvlTree()
        The default constructor.

      • AvlTree

        public AvlTree(int[] data)
        A constructor that builds the tree by adding the elements in the input array one by one. If a value appears more that once in the list, only the first appearance is added.
        Parameters:
        data - the values to add to the tree.

      • AvlTree

        public AvlTree(AvlTree avlTree)
        A copy constructor that creates a deep copy of the give AvlTree. This means that for every node or any other internal object of the given tree, a new, identical object, is instantiated for the new tree (the internal object is not simply referenced from it). The new tree must contain all the values of the given tree, but not necessarily in the same structure.
        Parameters:
        avlTree - an AVL tree.

      • contains

        public int contains(int searchVal)
        Check whether the tree contains the given input value.
        Specified by:
        contains in interface BinaryTree
        Overrides:
        contains in class BstTree
        Parameters:
        searchVal - the value to search for.
        Returns:
        the depth of the node (0 for the root) with the given value if it was found in the tree, -1 otherwise.

      • delete

        public boolean delete(int toDelete)
        Removes the node with the given value from the tree, if it exists.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface BinaryTree
        Overrides:
        delete in class BstTree
        Parameters:
        toDelete - the value to remove from the tree.
        Returns:
        true if the give value was found and deleted, false otherwise.

      • size

        public int size()
        Specified by:

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.Integer> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Integer>
        Overrides:
        iterator in class BstTree
        Returns:
        an iterator on the Avl Tree. The returned iterator iterates over the tree nodes in an ascending order, and does NOT implement the remove() method.

      • findMinNodes

        public static int findMinNodes(int h)
        Calculates the minimum number of nodes in an AVL tree of the height h.
        Parameters:
        h - the height of the tree (a non-negative number) in question.
        Returns:
        the minimum number of nodes in an AVL tree of the given height.
